ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: If the temperature of a black body is increased by 5%, then the percentage increase in total hemispherical emissive power of the body is
A solid sphere ‘1’ of radius r1 = 6 cm is placed concentrically inside a hollow sphere ‘2’ of radius r2. If it is desired to have the value of shape factor F21 = 0.65, then the value of r2 should be

The temperature distribution within the thermal boundary layer over a heated isothermal flat plate is given by where and T∞ are the temperature of the plate and free stream respectively, and y is the normal distance measured from the plate. The local heat transfer coefficient at plate surface is

where is thermal boundary layer thickness and kt is thermal conductivity of plate material
The ratio of total hemispherical emissive power to total intensity of the emitted radiation for a black body is

In M-L-T-θ system, the dimensional formula of thermal diffusivity is

where, M is mass, L is length, T is time and θ is thermodynamic temperature
A metallic rod attached to wall maintained at 150°C protrudes to the ambient air at 30°C. The temperature at the tip of the rod will be maximum when the rod is made of
The effectiveness of fin is defined as the ratio of
ENGLISH.OPT1: Actual heat transfer rate from the fin to the ideal heat transfer rate from the fin if the entire fin were at base temperature.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Actual heat transfer rate from the fin to the ideal heat transfer rate from the fin if the entire fin were at ambient temperature.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Heat transfer rate with fin to heat transfer rate without fin.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Heat transfer rate without fin to heat transfer rate with fin.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: Air at 25°C flows over a flat plate maintained at 80°C. The temperature at a distance of 0.5 mm from the surface of the plate is 55°C and the thermal conductivity of air is 0.027 W/mK. Assuming linear temperature variation in the direction normal to the plate surface, the value of local heat transfer coefficient is approximately
An indicator from an engine has a length of 100 mm and an area of 2000 mm2. If the indicator pointer deflects 10 mm for a pressure increment of 2 bar, the mean effective pressure is

In an ideal Otto cycle, 800 kJ/kg is transferred to air during the constant volume heat addition process and 381 kJ/kg is removed during the constant volume heat rejection process. The thermal efficiency in % of the cycle is _______. [Round off to one decimal place]

An air standard Otto cycle has compression ratio of 4. The compression ratio of this cycle is changed to 6. If the ratio of specific heat is 1.4, the percentage increase in its thermal efficiency is ______. (upto one decimal).

Two long rods of the same diameter, one made of brass (k = 90 W/mK) and the other of copper (k = 380 W/mK), have one of their ends inserted into a furnace. At a section 12.5 cm away from the furnace, the temperature of the brass rod is 140°C. Considering both rods are exposed to the same environment, the distance from the furnace end, the same temperature would be reached in the copper rod is ______ cm. (Round off to two decimal places)

A closed container with outside area 0.42 m2 and outside surface temperature of 0°C contains ice at 0°C. The container is placed in ambient air at 24°C and the surface coefficient of heat transfer between the container surface and the surrounding air is 6.5 W/m2K. Considering the latent heat of fusion of ice as 340 J/g, the rate of melting of ice is ______ kg/h. (Round off to three decimal places)

A rod of 4 cm diameter and 25 cm length is maintained at 120°C at one end and 20°C at the other end. These temperature conditions are attained when there is heat flow rate of 8 watts along the length of rod. If the outer cylindrical surface of the rod is completely insulated, the thermal conductivity of the rod material is _____ W/mK. (Round off to two decimal places)
Which of the above statement(s) is/are INCORRECT regarding emissivity?
ENGLISH.OPT1: The emissivity of Metallic surfaces is very high.
ENGLISH.OPT2: The presence of oxide layers may significantly increase the emissivity of metallic surfaces.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The emissivity of non conductors is high.
ENGLISH.OPT4: The emissivity of conductors decreases with increasing temperature.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: In a compression ignition engine, the ignition delay
ENGLISH.OPT4: decreases with increasing air inlet temperature

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A diesel engine takes in air at 1 bar and 27°C. The compression and expansion ratios are 17 and 8, respectively. Considering the specific heat at volume as 0.718 kJ/kgK and the ratio of specific heats at constant pressure and constant volume as 1.4, the heat energy added per kg of air is
Air at 1.01 bar and 25°C is supplied for complete combustion of methane (CH4). Assuming that air contains 21% O2 and 79% N2 by volume, the volume of air required to burn two kilograms of methane is

A 25 mm thick potato slab (thermal conductivity = 1 W/mK) is roasted with help of microwave heating. For a good quality roasting, it is desired that centre temperature of the slab be maintained at 120°C when the surrounding temperature is 30°C. If the heat transfer coefficient on the surface of the potato slab is 20 W/m2K, the required heating capacity in W/m3 of the microwave is _____. (Answer in integer)

A thermocouple is measuring the temperature of hot gas flowing in a duct whose walls are maintained at = 400 K shows a temperature reading of TC = 650 K. Assuming the emissivity of thermocouple junction to be and the convection heat transfer coefficient to be h = 80 W/m2K, the actual temperature of hot gas is

A copper wire (k = 400 W/mK) of radius 0.6 mm and 1 m length is insulated uniformly with plastic (k = 0.5 W/mK) sheathing 1 mm thick. The wire is exposed to atmosphere at 30°C and outside surface convection coefficient 12 W/m2K. Considering the specific electrical resistance of copper wire as 2 × 10–8 ohm-m, the maximum safe current carried by the wire so that no part of the insulated plastic is above 80°C is

A 30 cm thick slab is made of a material having thermal conductivity 60 W/mK. The temperature variation of steady state within the slab is given as

where, t is in °C and is the distance measured from left face, in meters

The heat generation rate per unit volume in the slab is

Two very long pieces of bare copper wire of 1.6 mm in diameter is required to solder together with a solder that melts at 195°C. The wires are positioned vertically in air at 25°C and the heat transfer coefficient on the wire surface is 18 W/m2K. Considering the thermal conductivity of the wire alloy as 340 W/mK, the minimum energy input required in soldering operation is ________ W. (Correct upto two decimal places)

A stainless steel wire (conductivity = 5 W/mK) of length 2 m and diameter 3 mm is submerged in a fluid at 50°C and convection heat transfer coefficient as 4000 W/m2K. If an electric current is passed through the wire, generating uniform internal heat generation of 500 W, the wire surface temperature and the maximum temperature in the wire, respectively are

Glass sphere of 3 mm radius and at 500°C are to be cooled by exposing them to an air stream at 25°C and convection coefficient 100 W/m2K. The density of glass is 2250 kg/m3; specific heat is 850 J/kgK and thermal conductivity is 1.5 W/mK. The time required for cooling the spheres to 60°C is ______ seconds.

(Round off to two decimal places)

The flat floor of a hemispherical furnace of diameter 1 m is at 700 K and has an emissivity of 0.5. The hemispherical roof of the furnace is at 1200 K and has an emissivity of 0.25. The net radiation heat transfer from the roof to floor is ______ W. (Round off to the nearest integer value)

A counter-flow heat exchanger of surface area 8 m2 is to be used to heat a process liquid by using a high temperature water available from another part of the plant. The inlet temperature, mass flow rate and specific heat of hot and cold fluid is given in the table below:

Considering the overall heat transfer coefficient as 480 W/m2K, the exit temperature of the hot fluid is ________ K. (Round off to two decimal places)

An air standard diesel engine has a compression ratio of 18 and the explosion takes place at of the stroke. Assuming ratio of specific heats as 1.4, the air standard efficiency (in percentage) is ______ (Round off to two decimal places)

An engine running on an standard Otto cycle has compression ratio 6. The work output (W) per cycle is given as : W = 35.2 × 105 VC, where VC is in m3 and W is in J. The indicated mean effective pressure (in kPa) of the cycle is __________. (Answer in integer)

An engine working on air standard Otto cycle is supplied with air at 1 bar and 50°C. The compression ratio is 8 and the heat supplied is 1200 kJ/kg. The maximum temperature (in K) of the cycle is ______. (Correct upto one decimal place) [Take, cP = 1.005 kJ/kgK, cV = 0.718 kJ/kgK and = 1.4]

An engine running on an air standard dual cycle is supplied with air at 1 bar and 320 K. The maximum pressure and temperature of the cycle is 60 bar and 2500 K, respectively. Considering the compression ratio of 16, the thermal efficiency of the cycle is _______ %. (Round off to one decimal place)

[Take, cP = 1.005 kJ/kgK, cV = 0.718 kJ/kgK and = 1.4]

A radiant energy with an intensity of 1200 W/m2 strikes a flat plate normally. The absorptivity of the plate is twice the transmissivity and thrice the reflectivity. Which of the above statement(s) is/are CORRECT?
ENGLISH.OPT1: The absorptivity of the plate is 0.1667.
ENGLISH.OPT2: The absorptivity of the plate is 0.5455.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The part of the incident radiation leaving the surface is 654.6 W/m2.
ENGLISH.OPT4: The part of the incident radiation leaving the surface is 545.5 W/m2.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A 3 cm thick steel plate of thermal conductivity 50 W/mK as shown in figure, has a uniform heat generation of 40 × 106 W/m3. The temperature of left and right faces are maintained at 160°C and 100°C, respectively. Considering a 1-D steady heat conduction, which of the above statement(s) is/are CORRECT?
ENGLISH.OPT1: The location of maximum temperature from left face will be 12.5 mm.
ENGLISH.OPT2: The location of maximum temperature from left face will be 17.5 mm.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The maximum temperature in the plate is 220°C.
ENGLISH.OPT4: The maximum temperature in the plate is 220°C.
